description: Lengths increase by 1, digits cycle through positive digits.
references: C. Ashbacher, Some Problems Concerning the Smarandache Deconstructive Sequence, J. Recreational Mathematics, Vol. 29, No. 2, pages 82-84.
K. Atanassov, On the 4th Smarandache Problem, Notes on Number Theory and Discrete Mathematics, Sophia, Bulgaria, Vol. 5 (1999), No. 1, 33-35.
links: K. Atanassov, On Some of Smarandache's Problems
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Smarandache Sequences
formula: a(n) = (10^9+1) a(n-9) - 10^9 a(n-18), n>=18 (corrected by _Michael Somos_, Sep 28, 2002).a(n) = Sum_{i=1..n} ((n*(n-1)/2+i-1 mod 9)+1)*10^(n-i). - Vedran Glisic, Apr 08 2011
author: R. Muller
